opendial.datastructs

Class Template

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.datastructs.Template

  • public class Template
extends java.lang.Object
    Representation of a string object containing a variable number (from 0 to n) of slots to be filled, forming a template.

    For instance, the raw string "Take the {BOX} to the {LOCATION}$ contains two slots: a slot labeled BOX and a slot labeled LOCATION.

    The class offers several methods for constructing template strings, matching them against strings, and filling their slots with specific values.

    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-02-04 09:51:48 #$
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

        public Template(java.lang.String value)

      • match

        public Template.MatchResult match(java.lang.String str,
                         boolean fullMatch)
        Checks whether the string is matching the template or not. The matching result contains a boolean representing the outcome of the process, as well (if the match is successful) as the boundaries of the match and the extracted slot values.
        Parameters:
        str - the string to check
        fullMatch - whether to use full or partial matching
        Returns:
        the matching result

      • isFilledBy

        public boolean isFilledBy(Assignment input)
        Returns true if the provided variables cover all of the slots in the template. Otherwise, returns false.
        Parameters:
        input - the input
        Returns:
        true if all slots can be filled, and false otherwise.

      • fillSlots

        public Template fillSlots(Assignment fillers)
        Fills the template with the given content, and returns the filled string. The content provided in the form of a slot --> filler mapping. For instance, given a template: "my name is {name}" and a filler "name --> Pierre", the method will return "my name is Pierre".

        In addition, the slot {random} is associated with a random integer number.

        Parameters:
        fillers - the content associated with each slot.
        Returns:
        the template filled with the given content
